sections.heading: Purpose of this screen
body: The Readings History screen provides a full overview of historical sensor data for a linked device and plant.
Unlike the Readings list (which shows only the latest values), this view focuses on trends and changes over time using charts.

sections.heading: Time ranges: Day, Week, Month
body: You can switch between three time ranges: Day, Week, and Month.
Day view shows readings for a single day in hourly intervals (assuming the device sends data hourly and the user accepts higher battery usage on the device side).
Week and Month views summarize readings across longer periods, allowing you to spot patterns and trends.

sections.heading: Measurement types
body: Charts are available for the following parameters: air temperature, air humidity, light level, and soil moisture (depending on what the device provides).
You select the parameter using the buttons under the chart (Temp, Hum, Light, Moist).

sections.heading: Navigating through past periods
body: The arrows next to the selected period allow you to move between previous days, weeks, or months.
Navigation is limited to periods where data exists — future periods are not displayed.

sections.heading: Data availability and interpretation
body: If the device has not provided readings for a selected period, the chart will appear empty or show missing values.
Sensor data is informative and should be interpreted together with real-world observation (calibration, placement, and environment can affect accuracy).
